intro: Dicoma ringoetii, commonly known as the Cape snowbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically gray-green and covered in fine, woolly hairs, providing a distinctive appearance. Dicoma ringoetii is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
